website_summaries.verdict: Small size makes it ideal for even the tiniest of work spaces.
pros: Surface is textured so that you can massage feet through socks
Grips on bottom prevent it from slipping around the floor
cons: Some said it would be the footrest of their dreams if it was height adjustable

website_summaries.verdict: A high-quality footrest that enables you to elevate your feet and legs at home or work.
pros: Features a free-floating platform that tilts back and forth for leg stretches
Offers a textured surface that creates a massaging effect on the soles of bare or socked feet
User-friendly, stay-put design guarantees the footrest stays in place on a carpet
cons: Very stiff in comparison to other footrests

customer_reviews.title: Great, except I wish it was height adjustable!
customer_reviews.text: I received this product last week and tried it out under my desk. I love how sturdy yet lightweight it is - it's easy to move around under your desk. The grips are nice for keeping your feet in place. Love the tilt, and doesn't make any noise. The only thing I don't like about it is that it's not height adjustable. I'm 5'4" and I need a footstool that's just a bit taller for me so that's the only reason I'm returning it and going with another footstool that's height adjustable (the Kensington Solemate). Other than that, it would be absolutely perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Can't adjust the height
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a foot rest, I would suggest you buy Mind Reader Adjustable Height Ergonomic Foot Rest if you wanted to to change the height of the foot rest. This foot rest is one height only.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Chihiro

customer_reviews.title: This product rocks too easily so it's not so much a foot-rest as a ...
customer_reviews.text: This product rocks too easily so it's not so much a foot-rest as a foot-swing. I even tried tightening the screws and that helps for about a day before it gets so loose it's almost unusable again.
customer_reviews.author: Dane

customer_reviews.title: I even tried wrapping tape around it to keep it in a comfortable tilt. This worked for a short period of ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this thinking there was no way to mess up a foot rest. However, the lack of lock for position makes this virtually worthless to me since it just swivels back and forth when you try to put your feet on it. I even tried wrapping tape around it to keep it in a comfortable tilt. This worked for a short period of time but then ended up just peeling off and leaving behind adhesive. Overall, I would not recommend this based on the inability for it to lock into the desired position.
customer_reviews.author: J. Uhrig

customer_reviews.title: I also like that it swivels
customer_reviews.text: Works well to elevate my legs, so helps with leg cramping when sitting at desk for long periods of time. I also like that it swivels. Be cautious too, if you use the swivel while sitting, it actually does work your calf muscles, I found my calves sore and couldn't figure out why. Stretch out your leg and calf muscles before sitting and using swivel for long periods of time (I'm at my desk working all day; almost every day).
customer_reviews.author: AmazonPrime User

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Durable Foot Rest!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! I'd honestly purchased this on a whim, purely on impulse. While I've had problems with sciatica and other aches sitting at my computer for long periods, just lately have I thought about ergonomics. After using a foot rest at work, I decided to get one. I had the idea that it would be made out of plastic, and was really surprised to pick up the package and realize how heavy it is! After setting up, it makes a world of difference already. The foot rest isn't static in place, so you can actually move your feet back and forth on it, which helps with the relaxation factor. This was a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: geofos

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my home office space and it’s comfy for my feet to rest on or fidget with while I work. I originally was going to purchase one that was double the price, but figured I’d try this one first. I’m glad I did! This item is sturdy and fulfills it’s purpose, no need to spend more than necessary! I am happy with my purchase and would highly recommend this item to others. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Eboney86

customer_reviews.title: and works great. The bottom rubber grips came off pretty quickly ...
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up for my work desk, and works great. The bottom rubber grips came off pretty quickly - but aren't really necessary for it to function. This definitely helped to improve my posture. I'm working from a different location for a few weeks, and wish I had brought my foot rest with me!
customer_reviews.author: Nick S

customer_reviews.title: Not so much rest for the feet
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a foot rest but this doesn't let them rest! Are you practicing to use an old fashioned sewing machine or loom? This would be perfect for that! It tilts so easily that my ankles are getting so much movement it has become abuse. I put a couple soda cans on the far side to keep it from tilting forward but I have to be careful for the backward tilt. It looks like it more has different settings in the pictures but there is nothing keeping it in place. Don't think it'd be work the hassle it to send back. Just be forewarned.
customer_reviews.author: Jen R

customer_reviews.title: Works just great!
customer_reviews.text: Using this at work right this second. I have had it for 3 months because I wanted to be sure I used it regularly before making a comment about it. It has a very smooth hinge that adjusts with very little foot pressure from either the toes or the heel. No squeaking or other noise from it, yet. I have tile under my desk, so it does slide a bit with too much pressure, but that's overall okay, because I can scoot it out of the way if I change my sitting position to the front of my chair and don't want my feet to be raised. My coworker liked mine so much that she ordered one for herself.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Metal, non locking classic ergo footrest
customer_reviews.text: If you like to change foot position to tilt back, down or rest flat or rock your feet THIS is the footrest. Height doesn’t raise and lower, but your chair should and your foot rest should compliment that. It’s not an ottoman, it’s ergonomics. Incredible quality and the price is very low ... perfect on the tread, metal, and silent movement. I’ve broken 2 squeaky plastic ergo footrests at the office and this is the solution. It has resolved my hip and back pain along with a decent chair.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: I normally love amazon basics products
customer_reviews.text: I normally love amazon basics products. this is the only thing i have ordered that i didn't like. It's super heavy and sharpish on the edges. It's also easy to accidentally squish your toes between where the footstool folds up.There's nothing to keep the solid metal pieces from clamping together and cutting your foot. I lost a toenail this way by using it barefoot and accidentally getting my foot underneath it when i was fidgeting. So this thing is going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.B.

customer_reviews.title: This product is useless. It slides around on the floor
customer_reviews.text: This product is useless. It slides around on the floor, whether carpeted or hardwood. It doesn't lock into position, the angle changes with very little effort, so it's tiring to "rest" your feet on. I need to brace my upper thighs against the underside of my desk in order to keep it from moving around. Like I said, useless. I'd return it, but I missed the window to do so.
customer_reviews.author: CrazyCurls

customer_reviews.title: It’s OK.
customer_reviews.text: Ehh, it’s OK. Smaller than I thought and I wish the motion of the footrest was not so loose. I also wish there was a way to “lock” the angle at which you prefer the footrest to remain at. It is made of metal and the rubber is sturdy. Perhaps I should have just bought a higher-end product that suited my specific needs, but at least I do have place to rest my feet while at the computer all day, so I will keep it. Perhaps this is why it’s called, Amazon”basics” ...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I hate this thing
customer_reviews.text: I hate this thing. It sits useless in the corner of my office. Why do I hate it? It doesn't lock. your feet will rock back and forth forever, no matter how tight you tighten the screws. What's the point of a foot rest when you can't rest your feet on this? It's not height adjustable - everyone needs different heights for their body. Why is this only one height? Don't buy this - buy anything else at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ning Wong

customer_reviews.title: Right price - right product!
customer_reviews.text: I originally paid a LOT more to get a plastic version, thinking I didn't have any other choices. Fortunately, another reviewer pointed this one out. I'm not sure if it's metal, or a composite that feels like metal, but it is heavy duty. It's solid with a very basic slide, so there's very little to break or go wrong. It's firm, so actually takes some effort to move it. It's compact, so will discreetly fit under your desk, on the passenger side of a car, or at the foot of a chair. Using it regularly DOES make a difference, especially if you have circulation or lower leg issues, or even to help keep arthritic ankles/feet loose and flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Been There Done That

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Will not stay at the angle I set it to. Does not hold its position on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: D. Perron

customer_reviews.title: Works great and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Just had it for a couple of days but very Happy with it. Nice construction for the price. Nice swivel feature to adjust and move position of your feet. Wish it could adjust higher at times. When I have my office chair up a couple of inches the footrest doesn't seem quite high enough. Again for the price ... you will be happy. Good value and function! Quick delivery and service!
customer_reviews.author: Hal

customer_reviews.title: Crucial work from home equipment
customer_reviews.text: I have a standing desk at home and at work and this thing is awesome. The foot rest at work is cheap plastic, came from a large office supply chain place, and cost more than this one did. The plastic ones will crack eventually but this thing is heavy duty, metal, very sturdy. I can put a lot of weight on it and It's great for when you're seated, too. It pivots very easily so my foot/feet are always in a comfortable position. Take the pressure off your lower back with this awesome home office upgrade. Tell your office supply purchaser to skip the cheap plastic garbage from the office supply place, too.
customer_reviews.author: T Free

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed!
customer_reviews.text: Working from home during quarantine has caused me to try and figure out my "workspace" pretty quickly - well needless to say my posture was suffering and I was beginning to get some pain in my right wrist, until I bought this and began using it. It fits perfectly under my desk and it's so nice to be able to move my feet, my ankles, and flex my calf muscles while working. This has been a lifesaver, it fixed my posture almost immediately! Thanks, Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: CaliMom26

customer_reviews.title: Great if you fidget
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty short and I work a desk job, so I wanted a foot rest to help me sit more properly at my desk. This works well for me. The height isn't adjustable, but I've managed to make it work at two different offices (one with adjustable desk and one without). My favorite feature is that the angle of the footrest isn't something that's locked in place. I can move it up and down easily and silently with my feet to stretch my ankles and calves throughout the day. The one thing I don't like is that the little caps covering the ends of the metal tubes come off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie M. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Almost What I Hoped For
customer_reviews.text: This would be great if there was a way to lock the movement of the foot rest. Its solid and is well made, definitely improves ergonomics, but it slips way too easily. I solved this with some duct tape, but its not really elegant. It would have been nice if the design included a way to lock it into one position.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the feet
customer_reviews.text: Due to this pandemic, I've had to work from home and my legs would be hurting from being sedentary. This product is great, it stays in place and doesn't move. It stays in place but you can also apply pleasure and tilt it up and down similar to a seesaw. Helps stretch and provide motion to your legs. (Tip: you can add a small pillow to the top and add extra comfort to your feet if needed)
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Well built and effective
customer_reviews.text: Got this for use under my desk at work, I have plantar fasciitis in both feet and wanted something that would help me keep my heels down and stretched out, instead of always having my feet propped up awkwardly on the legs of my rolly office chair. I've found it really comfortable. It's a surprisingly heavy-duty metal item, and the pivot is really smooth (just be careful if you're carrying it somewhere, I pinched my finger in it pretty bad because I wasn't paying much attention). Seriously shocked at how good the construction is for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: M.K.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I use a small pillow for comfort, others may like the stimulation of the bare tread. Fits perfectly in my knee hole. I thought I would not like that it was not fixable in one position, but I find I move my feet all the time and this accommodates perfectly. Some have commented that the rubber feet slip off. I cannot even pull mine off, though I suspect a little glue would solve the problem. I also did not find blemishes, which would not bother me anyway for an under the desk item. All-in-all recommended.
customer_reviews.author: E. Waldorph

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: This foot rest isn't great, and it isn't bad. It's not tall enough to provide optimal comfort, or much comfort at all but it does allow you to rest your feet at a comfortable angle, which again is better than nothing. I think to be truly comfortable and useful, I would need an elevated foot rest at least 6-8 inches from the ground. This only raises you about 3-4 inches from the pivot point. I also wish it had a locking mechanism to keep it at a particular angle when you stretch your legs out. Without the ability to lock, the footrest tips in the other direction.
customer_reviews.author: Minh N

customer_reviews.title: No moor knee pain
customer_reviews.text: I'm short and my feet struggle to hit the ground. That makes my knees hurt over the course of a day sitting in front of a computer. I like this product because the foot rest part tilts forward and back so I can easily find a setting that is best for me. The footrest is sturdy and I think will last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Good, sturdy, foot rest.
customer_reviews.text: Functional and study though, the rubber feet do slide off the rails on the bottom if you fidget around as much as I do. I applied a small amount of glue and they haven't moved since. I like that the angle adjustment is smooth and silent, not sure if it locks in place or not-- I like being able to shift it around. Best for use with shoes as I found the texture to be a little uncomfortable on bare skin during extended use. That said I much prefer the durable hard surface over some of the gel/cushioned alternatives that get dirty / fall apart over time.
customer_reviews.author: John Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Good basic foot rest.
customer_reviews.text: This was the right height for me, posture wise, and has a nice grippy surface. It's light enough to easily move around when needed. My only issue with it is that once you get it at the right angle, there is no way to lock it in place. You can always rock it back and forth with your feet. This is good in a way because it's responsive, but most of the time I'd rather be able to tighten a screw down to lock them at the same angle.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L.

customer_reviews.title: No regrets
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of my favorite under $20 purchases I’ve made on amazon. It really works well and does add a substantial element of comfort for my feet and legs at my desk. There are comments about it being too loose I found two screws underneath that can easily be tightened with a #2 Phillips screwdriver to the desired stiffness. The carpet I have it on is pretty tall so I don’t have any slipping issues, it stays put. Like others have said the only thing I would change would be night adjustment, but for the price point it exceeds my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Reesefam

customer_reviews.title: Happy Wife, Happy Life!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife since we both wfh due to the pandemic. I'm 6'1 and my wife is 5' tall so when she sits at her desk her feet are off the ground. These solved the problem. She could use it forwards or backwards bc it's adjustable. She swears by them and she said it makes her feel more comfortable and it's a good thing she has it bc she uses it almost every day. They aren't fancy and they weren't expensive, they do what they are intended to do and that's all I care about. Happy wife, happy life!
customer_reviews.author: Gqsmooth1981

customer_reviews.title: Get one of these if you work at a desk all day.
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing, For the price and what you get in terms of quality, its the best out there. Its not some cheap flimsy looking one like the rest at that price range or higher, its actually sturdy metal and well built. Now on to what these actually do, if you sit at a desk all day, i would suggest getting this. it helps you sit upright at all times as opposed to slouching like I used to do (my scoliosis would act up cause of this) and it even doubles as a foot and calf stretcher since it works like a seesaw and you can point your feet downward to stretch them out.
customer_reviews.author: AznMikeD

customer_reviews.title: I spent hours researching footrests- this is the right one! Get it!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the office but kept it at home. Very sturdy. It has a smooth sliding hinge - mechanism that allows me to 'rock' my feet. Doesn't slide on my plastic carpet protector or on the carpet. I use it at my home computer desk and in the den when I'm on the sofa watching tv. Who KNEW it would feel great someplace besides at my desk!?!? Love it! If they were free I'd have one in every room AND I'd have one at the office. P.S. I originally bought this for the office but like it too much at home to take it there.I'm going to have to buy a 2nd one for the office.
customer_reviews.author: MCarter

customer_reviews.title: My mom loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 68-year-old mother's right foot has a tendency to tense up after standing and walking around a little while, so I got her this item hoping it could take some edge off. She loves that the footstool is ergonomic, and has the perfect amount of tension to allow her to nicely rock her feet back and forth on it.
customer_reviews.author: Allie Jean

customer_reviews.title: No locking in place
customer_reviews.text: One of the issues with the product, having purchased two at this point, is that it doesn't look in place. So, if you want the step to be at an angle and stay there despite any pressure from your feet, it won't stay and it will pivot back and forth. It defeats the purpose of having one of these then in my view. Also, tightening the screws underfeed doesn't work and be careful since they are held with a plastic covering that can crack, though that didn't happen to me.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Mine was a bit messed up aestetically but it works.
customer_reviews.text: It appeared that there was a lot of adhesive that got on the inside edge of the outer band. Some of that must have seeped over and a cardboard box must have been clued to it. It was not the same box that it came in though, it didn't have coordinating tear in the box. The adhesive is impressive. I have been unable to remove it and have tried many different methods. At least its under the desk so it won't be seen much. All that said, it does serve its purpose and its cheap. I hope the photo is close enough for you to see what I'm referring to.
customer_reviews.author: T Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Helps take pressure off low back by elevating feet when seated!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I bought this for my office. Since I got it a few months ago my lower back feels 100% better!!! I used to have a really difficult time after getting up from my office chair as my lower back would be extremely stiff. Not anymore; this foot rest helps keep my feet elevated and takes the pressure off my lower back. I wish it was just about 4 inches higher for more comfort but it does the job! No more pain for me.
customer_reviews.author: Cactus Flower

customer_reviews.title: wish it was wider, wish it was taller (but I knew that before I bought it)
customer_reviews.text: The rotation back and forth is pretty loose. I've decided I don't mind it moving. Needs to be wider. Honestly like 3" would make a big difference. I guess I just like my feet wider apart. I have it sitting on a foam block, but I knew it would be too short when I bought it. The other products I was reviewing were heavy on plastic with reviews about broken parts. This is mostly metal and seems pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad For The Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid addition to any desk. It's has a easy slope so it's comfortable to slip into position on it. About the only complaint I have it that it doesn't seem to lock into place, so I'm accidentally tipping it the wrong direction all the time. That's annoying and it could've really used a built in latch. I suppose the idea is you can angle it to your seated position but even then you'd have a hard time keeping it on an even keel. I'll have to hit the hardware store and buy something that'll lock it in place.
customer_reviews.author: evatar

customer_reviews.title: Professional Look, Needs Improvement
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for under my desk at work. It has a sleek professional design and looks like it belongs in my office as opposed to standing out like a sore thumb. The platform swivels which I suppose is useful, but I wish it has a locking mechanism so it would be a firm surface. I also wish it had a height adjustment so I could raise my feet up a few more inches. But it does serve to ease pressure on my low back. I was a little disappointed but not enough to return it. It's still useful.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Levin

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend- I have 2
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, I have 2 now, one at home and one at work. It is sturdy and with it's adjustable surface makes it great for any position you feel comfortable at the time. I am a big guy and the weight of my legs has not been an issue, this footrest is constructed very well. *I don't have any "pain issues" so could not give any stars for "pain relief" above. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Royib812

customer_reviews.title: One Major Flaw Ruins It
customer_reviews.text: It's fairly straightforward. It's a footrest, it's sturdy, and it looks like it does in the picture. HOWEVER, it does not lock into place, making it almost useless. When you put your feet on it, they're in a constant state of movement, like a teeter-totter. You can tilt it forward to the point where it can't move (it's resting on the floor), but that's also the most uncomfortable position for your feet to be in.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: It's good enough for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent foot rest for the price. I tend to sit for several hours at a time. I have been using this in the past couple of days in combination with a lumber support insert. This swivels which took me a while to get used to but I am starting to like it. I will follow the advice of another user and buy something to keep it from slipping around and will also tighten the screws so that it doesn't swivel so easily.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Basic foot rest does the job at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I recently acquired a new computer/craft desk and it's a bit taller than the norm. I bought this to relieve the pressure on my feet and legs and it does a great job. I like the metal body and rubberized top, and also that it rocks a bit. Mine is pretty stable, doesn't move up and down unless I want it to, and it's easy to move from the computer side of the desk to the crafting side. It's on a hardwood floor and doesn't slide around, perfect for my needs and a great price. I've had several at work that were plastic and never liked them, this one is great.
customer_reviews.author: Becky L

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for short people!
customer_reviews.text: I'm only 5' tall and have to prop my feet on something when sitting at my computer desk. This is the perfect foot rest, with adjustable height option.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Excelent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I really like almost everything that comes from Amazon's brand, AmazonBasics. This is not an exception; it's a simple, good product, very comfortable. It's a moving footrest, so it adjusts perfectly according to the angle you're seated, your height, etc. I'm working from home, and my sciatica is killing me. I got a new chair, and with footrest, the pain is almost gone. A+
customer_reviews.author: JCohen

customer_reviews.title: I like it, no need height adjustment
customer_reviews.text: I used to use the swing type for my lets/feet, but after a while dusts built up and it gave my feet some rashes/hives (I go barefoot in the house). It's a fabric so it was harder to keep clean/maintain. This footrest is easier to wipe and keep dusts off of it. It can be slanted towards or away from u and can also be flat. No need height adjustment, it'st he chair u sit in that needs to be height adjusted if needed.
customer_reviews.author: It's me

customer_reviews.title: Improve Circulation
customer_reviews.text: Amazon Basics Under the Desk Foot Rest provides a means of stimulating circulation in my legs while I am sitting at my desk in front of the computer. It is manually operated so you do not need access to an outlet, allows you to do your motion at your own pace. I am mostly wheelchair bound so I worry about lower leg blood clots and this alleviates some of the worry and also helps with muscle tone
customer_reviews.author: granny1

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I have chronic pain. As such, I have difficulty sitting in positions that require my knees to be at 90°. My back eventually hurts, & fluids tend to settle in my lower legs. After much research, I bought this foot rest & have been very happy with it. It's not feather weight, but it's easy enough for me to take to my friends house on game night. Using it, I can sit much longer without having to get up to move around & stretch.
customer_reviews.author: Greenwink

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I used this at work for a while, now it's used at home. I am a fidgeter, so the free moving nature of this foot rest is great for me, so I can adjust it whenever I want. But the other side of that is it doesn't "lock" into any set position.
customer_reviews.author: Josie Solari

customer_reviews.title: MY FEET ARE ON IT NOW!
customer_reviews.text: Who would have thought this little device would eliminate so many conditions from sitting /computer working/ all day and sitting /computer enjoyment long evenings!!!! I luv the movability of it too. I rock my feet back and forth to exercise my ankles and calves while sitting, prevents leg cramps, I find. Solid made, stable with a weightier floor stand. Even my puppy stands on it to get my attention!
customer_reviews.author: Stevie

customer_reviews.title: Not a well made footrest
customer_reviews.text: The tolerances for this foot rest must be very large because mine wobbles like crazy on the hardwood. I would not recommend this design on hardwood since it needs to be perfectly symmetric or you are going to get wobble. I added a cabinet door bumper to one side to get it to stop wobbling but it falls off a lot due to the pressure of your feet. I wouldn't buy this again or recommend it to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: J White

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Simple, sturdy, and does what it says it does. If you're wanting fancy, this is not what you need, however, if you just want a simple footrest that keeps your feet off the floor and can fit anywhere, including around cords, this is your choice. Heavier than expected and so far no issues with the tilting or the shifting on the floor that other reviews state. Simple, no frills, works!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Hancock

customer_reviews.title: This is a brilliant invention. Put it right up there with the lightbulb.
customer_reviews.text: If you work at a desk all day, you will really appreciate this. You can move your legs as you work and if you need another inch or so of height for your desk, this will give it to you. I got it bc I needed about 2-3 more inches of height to adjust my chair so my shoulders weren't killing me at the end of the day. I would up really loving the rocking you can do with your feet. Try it. You'll like it!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Mobley

customer_reviews.title: Love this footrest
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best $11.98 I've ever spent on Amazon. Love this footrest. I work from home, normally 10 to 12 hours per day. This footrest is invaluable to my comfort while sitting at my desk. It's good quality, built of metal (not plastic). Has rubber feet on the bottom to keep it in place. Tilts back and forth as needed. has little rubbery nubbly thingies on the surface to grip and massage the bottom of your feet. The only question I have is... why did I wait so long to purchase this?
customer_reviews.author: Lauranator

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for 1 day. But I am very pleased with it! I have it under my desk at work. I hate wearing shoes while sitting for long periods of time, but I don't trust this dirty carpet to put my feet on (while wearing socks of course). But I can put them on this now! The textured surface is nice for my fidgety feet. And, you can rock it back and forth. It's big enough for my size 13 feet, but small enough to never be noticed. There is plenty wiggle room as well. Great investment!!
customer_reviews.author: Lee M.

customer_reviews.title: Improved an expensive office chair for shorter person
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for one of my employees that has a larger office chair but is on the short side in height. It has been great! Not only did it improve her chair but her overall back issues as well. We also purchased a back rest that accommodated her as well. I think a overall investment of about $50 to modify a nice $400 office chair for her. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Katie R

customer_reviews.title: Noice. Smort.
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It is rubber and metal, doesn't look as much like a weird plastic medical device as some of the other ones. Some reviews say the rubber feet things come off, and other reviews say the box was opened... mine came with the box opened and rubber feet firmly attached. I am curious if they opened all the boxes to glue the feet on. As of June 2019 there doesn't seem to be any problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Solidly Built!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is built like a tank. It makes a huge difference when I'm sitting for long periods. By keeping my feet up, I do not slouch anymore, and sitting is much more comfortable. I used to get sore in my upper back, shoulders, and neck but, not since I started using the footrest. I get so comfortable that I have to set an Alexa reminder so I'll get up and move now and then.
customer_reviews.author: toolsrrr

customer_reviews.title: Only useful if your feet already touch the floor
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea what or how this footrest is supposed to help. As I sit at my desk my toes just about reach the floor, so I was looking for something that I could sit my feet on. Unfortunately, every time I put my feet on this contraption, it moves, resulting in me either sitting like a ballerina en pointe or flexing like I just went for a jog. The only way I can see this working is if you are already able to put your feet flat on the floor. It's durable though, so not all bad.
customer_reviews.author: M. Polk

customer_reviews.title: Good for short people
customer_reviews.text: I have had many similar products over the past couple of years. Sitting at desk height with comfortable arm reach always seems to leave my feet just short of the floor. This foot rest is great for day long use. I have had it for over a year now and I am especially happy with the quality. It is the highest quality I have bought so far.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dudley

customer_reviews.title: Don't Delay, order more than one today!
customer_reviews.text: This was a smart purchase for me. I sprained my ankle a month ago; and sometimes, when I sit at my desk for long periods of time, it feels uncomfortable. This footrest allows me to take the pressure off and increase circulation. Additionally, my back hurts less. I can get more work done when I am comfortable. I am going to purchase another for my daughter. I love that I can pivot the footrest up and down. Get this for your college kids.
customer_reviews.author: Patrice

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't go as high as I'd like
customer_reviews.text: I wish it raised a bit higher or even had that option to go higher. I didn't realize this wasn't a feature when I purchased. That's my bad. But it's their bad for not making it that way already. It's good otherwise. Helps me feel better while working at my office job and sitting at a desk all day. And helps with my fidgeting some.
customer_reviews.author: supjennifer

customer_reviews.title: Okay for a foot rest, doesn't rock easily
customer_reviews.text: Adequate foot rest but the rocking motion is clunk and it moves around too much if you try to rock, and that is on carpet. Have to constantly pull the thing back towards me after rocking feet. Jusy okay.
customer_reviews.author: mscys

customer_reviews.title: Screws that hold this in place are cheap and anchored ...
customer_reviews.text: Screws that hold this in place are cheap and anchored in plastic. Any amount of use causes it to tilt back and forth, and tightening the screws just shortens their life.
customer_reviews.author: HighLearn

customer_reviews.title: Great, but if you want to tighten to the tilt you need to screw in the side screws
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic, I works exactly as described and doesn't appear to slide around on the floor at all. One thing to note, the top will move/tilt unless you tighten the mechanism on the side with a screwdriver. I believe this is a feature NOT a con, however I wish it was not a screw and rather a hand tightener. Deployed under a desk.
customer_reviews.author: Some_Technophile

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: For years and years I have sat awkwardly in my office chair because I am too short for my back to be against the back of the chair and my feet to touch the floor at the same time. After increasing back pain, I decided to try this product ... and I love it! Such a simple thing, yet it has made a world of difference in my comfort level when I am working at my desk.
customer_reviews.author: L. Creed

customer_reviews.title: It's alright.
customer_reviews.text: I use it daily. Gets the job done but I find it a little to short for me. I really wish I could adjust how tall it is. Also, if you are short is definitely a must have to avoid backpain.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Just love this foot stand!
customer_reviews.text: I sit at my desk for 8 hours a day and I am 5'10" and my legs are always not at the right angle. I bought this foot stand to help me elevate my legs to the correct height and not put pressure on my back. I love how my feet rest at the proper angle and I love that it tilts forward so I can stretch my legs, especially my calves. Highly recommend for anyone who has to sit for a long period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Ann Heller

customer_reviews.title: Good build but very STIFF slide action. Not fun for my feet.
customer_reviews.text: This foot rest is well built but there was one thing that really annoyed me and that is the slide action. When you slide the foot rest it isn't smooth but very stiff and grindy. It's as though they painted the rails with sticky textured paint. I thought that maybe it would go away after using it for a little while but it didn't. I even oil it but that didn't help much either. I think it just may be designed this way. I wanted something that my foot can play with but this foot rest is so stiff it's not even fun. I ended up not even using it.
customer_reviews.author: James T.

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: It’s just okay. Pros: the price is good and it’s good quality, fast shipping, I like the rocking quality. Cons: it’s not wide enough like my stance is wider under my desk, I’m not a tiny person. It’s not high enough, I’d like it a few inches higher. I may have to buy another more expensive footrest to suit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: neafer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful office product with a side benefit for adhd anxiety.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product ! I have one at work and one at home. As an adult with ADHD anxiety, I like that you can move it front and back on the swivel while you're working.
customer_reviews.author: Givnstar

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I'm short and I use this under my desk at work so that I can still keep my chair at a good level in relation to the desk. I've used it for nearly a year and would recommend. It swivels forward and back but can't be adjusted up and down. I haven't found that to me an issue for me. It's not fancy, but it has been helpful for me.
customer_reviews.author: EP

customer_reviews.title: Helps with ciruculation and leg fatigue
customer_reviews.text: I bought this foot rest due to my varicose veins/circulation issue, and more specifically because I'm pregnant. I really think this foot rest has helped ease the stress on my legs while sitting all day at a desk and allowed my ankles to keep from swelling during pregnancy. The fact that it swivels back and forth has been a great feature. It allows my legs to be comfortable no matter what angle I'm sitting in my chair and especially because I tend to fidget while sitting for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Alys

customer_reviews.title: Not a good foot rest. Keeping it in case I find another purpose for it.
customer_reviews.text: The footrest doesn't hold its angles well, but feels very high quality. They aren't very comfortable to rest my feet on, though, because it can't hold its angles. The IKEA's footrest, on the other hand, holds its position well but feels very cheap. In the end I opted for the IKEA footrest, and later replaced that with the "YogaAccessories MAX Support Deluxe Round Cotton Yoga Bolster". The downside of the bolster is that it retains heat well, making it bad for hot weather.
customer_reviews.author: UNKNOWN

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that I was not expecting this quality. It is very well made and it allows me to keep my feet positioned so I don't tuck them under my desk chair, a bad habit I had which caused a lot of knee pain. It is easily adjusted, but remains positioned as I like it. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Not the boss of me.
customer_reviews.text: My feet have never rested so comfortably! Except maybe when I put them up on my desk. The boss does not like it but now that I am working from home (thanks Trump, I mean COVID) the boss cannot see my feet on my desk so to get I say”you’re not the boss of me. Solid quality.
customer_reviews.author: Shady Gady

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: this is a very sturdy foot rest I use at my home desk. It's perfect height and much better quality than another one I purchased 2 years ago that eventually broke underneath and became unusable. the other one was plastic and not made very well, the swivel ended up breaking. But this one is great. I'll be buying one for my office at work
customer_reviews.author: Melisa

customer_reviews.title: Simple but gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I find this to be a very helpful addition to my desk. It allows me to sit up higher to get my hands in a better working position on the computer, and still maintain contact with my feet on the ground. I think it’s better suited for an office where you are wearing shoes all day. The movement it’s nice, as it’s steady unless you press with your heels or toes to adjust it.
customer_reviews.author: robhallphotoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd gotten this ages ago.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I'm a woman of average height and I just needed a little floor rise to be able to have my chair high enough for my monitor. It's sturdy & is kind of fun to rock my feet back & forth on :). Helps me keep moving just a little while I'm sitting in that chair too long. Visually it won't draw too much attention, esp not under the desk.
customer_reviews.author: VideoWriter

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had pain in my back and hips when sitting for hours at my computer. I tried many products with little success so I admit I was skeptical about this one, but it actually works! I can't explain why it prevents such pain, but it does! Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: D. Channing

customer_reviews.title: This stool made it so I can work with reduced pain
customer_reviews.text: This stool seems to be well made. It stays still once I put it the hard floor. There is no slippiint around. I love this stool. It puts my legs in the perfect position under my desk. I am 5’3” so sometimes where a chair needs to sit for me to type comfortably is not where it needs to be for my feet. This along with the cushions I bought for my back and seat have made it possible for me to work for much less pain. I can also move my feet back & forth which helps with circulation. I had no clue how big of a difference a foot stool would make.
customer_reviews.author: Jep0331

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Gadget
customer_reviews.text: Gives my back the support I need when sewing. Love that you can adjust it to different angles. I have an embroidery/sewing machine and I spend a good deal of time working on a variety of projects. We recently moved and I had to make some adjustments to my sewing/craft room. Downsizing is really not for the faint of heart, but this helped make my new area a lot more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Flying Lady 76

customer_reviews.title: Review for open package
customer_reviews.text: The product had apparently been opened at some point before it arrived. The product label had been broken over the box tabs indicating that it may possibly have been a returned item or opened at some point. The item was in plastic, but when I removed the plastic, I could see oily hand and fingerprints. I wiped the item down with mild bacterial disinfectant wipes and retained it. Other than that, it appears to be functioning as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I spend a lot of time at my desk at home and was using a step stool to put my feet up on, this product is soo much better! It fits under my desk better than the stool, it is sturdy, and I like that it is movable so I can stretch my ankles and calves out while I work. It is exactly how it is advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Smith

customer_reviews.title: but i rather like this thing
customer_reviews.text: to be honest i felt a little silly buying something what essentially a small box could do, but i rather like this thing. i need a little leg support due to the height of my chair/table, and this works out great. very sturdy and comfortable. my one wish is that i would like it if i could lock the platform in place instead of letting it swivel (not that it's not fun rocking it back and forth).
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Not good if you sit with your legs stretched. Dont get blinded with the reviews!
customer_reviews.text: This product is good quality but fails functionally when its tiled outwards. If you wanna stretch legs, the platform droops down outwards providing no support. The hinge got smooth after a month of use and now the tilting mechanism do not provide any support. It just droops down as soon as you put your foot on it. Infact I got stiff leg with this product for over 2 weeks. Not recommended. I got blinded by the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Prashant S Sengar

customer_reviews.title: Easily adjustable
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a rather good foot rest. I do find that the tilt feature is a little loose for my taste and I would prefer something either a bit more stiff or a dial to tighten the tilt, but others may appreciate it more to stretch their muscles without having to bend over to make an adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie

customer_reviews.title: I should have measured.
customer_reviews.text: It came missing a rubber stopper on the bottom. I needed this to use under a tv tray and did not measure the area I need to use it in and it's wider than I need, so I am not able to use it. I do like that it's metal and not plastic. I like that it moves but wished I was able to stop it from moving as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nova Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love this footrest. I bought it to replace a different one that fell apart after a couple years. This one is very sturdy and feels like it will last a long time. The swivel feature makes it very comfortable for stretching your calves during the day. It is also a great height. I put some felt pads on the the bottom to prevent it from scratching my wood floor and it's working great. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy footrest, great for shorter people or people with taller desks
customer_reviews.text: Genius product/where has this been all of my life? Finally I can sit at a desk and keep my feet "on the floor" *and* have my arms at the correct level for typing/mousing. Simple product -- pivots forward and backward but does not raise/lower, so offers only a few inches of elevation, but that's all I needed. Good quality and withstands the abuse of shoes/weight easily.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect height for under my work desk
customer_reviews.text: Perfect height for under my work desk. The foot rest is slightly adjustable but stays put (both in the angle and where you place it on the floor), which is what I wanted. It is also discreet in case people walk by, and made of quality coated metal. I am pregnant and dealing with back pain, and this takes all the pressure off of my back by angling it to rest fully on the chair. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen R. Yeany

customer_reviews.title: This footrest has some good weight to it and is extremely durable
customer_reviews.text: This footrest has some good weight to it and is extremely durable, made of some metal. I like how the backing is metal and allows you to easily adjust the angle of the footrest. I had an old one that was plastic. This one is a good value. The condition of the packaging was disappointing. The box was opened when the delivery person handed it to me. Someone intentionally slit the box open but fortunately everything was in place. It's disturbing that someone tampered with the box.
customer_reviews.author: T. Chau

customer_reviews.title: Not for elevating feet, needs lock function
customer_reviews.text: Not really a good foot rest in the traditional sense, which would mean extra height. Your feet won't be elevated with this. You will, however, get your feet tilted in the best angle for good ergonomics. Comfortable so far, but I wish there was a feature to lock it in a particular angle.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan C.

customer_reviews.title: Very solid, doesn't slip, quality material!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great price for a solid, good quality foot rest! It has made working from home much more comfortable! It is heavy but not too heavy--doesn't slip on my tile floor and tilts smoothly according to where your foot rests on it. I wish I had one like it at work, too! I may buy a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Beatriz Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Horrible QC but works
customer_reviews.text: My photos speak volumes so just look at those. For the price I'm kinda ok with the unit I got but be aware of the QC for this... remember it's just a Amazon rebadged item from outside the US. Don't plan on returning it because my hopes aren't that high that I'll get anything better, they're all probably going to be like that. It works so at least I can use it.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Was Looking For
customer_reviews.text: The seating cushions on our sofa are a bit too long front-to-back, causing the back of my knees and calves to rub against the front of the sofa when I'm sitting upright. Accordingly, I've been looking for a foot rest that raises my feet and legs just enough to alleviate that constant, annoying pressure. This foot rest allows me to extend my legs a little and gets my feet off the floor just enough to be comfortable. It is well-made and has enough bulk to avoid sliding on our wood floor. Good purchase and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: dwaynegee

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and since I am only 4'11 I definitely need one of these. I suffer from chronic back pain, and this helps reduce it, which allows me to focus better at work since I am no longer focused on my pain. I am more comfortable at my desk now. Like most, I wish it was height adjustable as well which is why I gave it 4 stars, but other than that - great product for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Erika Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: you will probably like this one
customer_reviews.text: Infuriatingly pivots back and forth at the slightest touch, rendering it totally unusable until you jam a rolled up Crystal Pepsi can into the pivoting mechanism to keep it in place. Tightening the screws on the pivot thing did nothing. I think if you really WANT a footrest that pivots back and forth, you will probably like this one. The build quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this foot rest because my feet dangled at my office desk, which became uncomfortable over time. It was an "Amazon choice" which was the deciding factor for me in choosing it over others. I didn't need anything fancy, just a footrest with angle adjustment that wouldn't slide on a carpeted floor and this product fits the bill! It's cheaper than the other models and seems to be a simpler design. I'm happy with my selection
customer_reviews.author: Ridge008

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics Under Desk Foot Rest - Black
feature_bullets: Footrest for placement under a desk offers enhanced comfort when working
Elevates feet and legs when sitting
Free-floating platform tilts back and forth for leg stretches and increased circulation
Textured surface creates a massaging effect on soles of bare or socked feet
Stays securely in place on carpet

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars7,206 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
